TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed RegexOptions extends System.Enum

summary.span: Provides enumerated values to use to set regular expression options.

span.span: Provides enumerated values to use to set regular expression options.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Um valor pode ser fornecido como um parâmetro para os seguintes membros de classe:A value can be provided as a parameter to the following members of the class: - O construtor de classe.The class constructor. - O método .The method. - O método .The method. - O método .The method. - O método .The method. - O e métodos.The and methods. Um valor também pode ser fornecido como um parâmetro para o construtor, ou ele pode ser atribuído diretamente para o propriedade.A value can also be supplied as a parameter to the constructor, or it can be assigned directly to the property. Resultante objeto é usado na chamada para o método.The resulting object is then used in the call to the method. Várias opções fornecidas por membros do enumeração (em particular, por seus membros captura explícita, IgnoreCase, várias linhas e Singleline) em vez disso, pode ser fornecida por meio de um caractere de opção embutida no padrão de expressão regular.Several options provided by members of the enumeration (in particular, by its ExplicitCapture, IgnoreCase, Multiline, and Singleline members) can instead be provided by using an inline option character in the regular expression pattern. Para obter detalhes, consulte [opções de expressão Regular](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md).For details, see [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md). ## Examples O exemplo a seguir define duas expressões regulares que identificar palavras repetidas em texto, mas que são instanciados usando diferentes valores.The following example defines two regular expressions that identify repeated words in text but that are instantiated using different values. A primeira expressão regular diferencia maiusculas de minúsculas; caso é ignorado ao determinar se uma palavra é idêntica à palavra anterior.The first regular expression is case-insensitive; case is ignored when determining whether a word is identical to the preceding word. A segunda expressão regular diferencia maiusculas de minúsculas; uma palavra deve corresponder ao uso da palavra anterior exatamente a ser considerado uma duplicata.The second regular expression is case-sensitive; a word must match the case of the preceding word exactly to be considered a duplicate. [!code-csharp[System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions/cs/RegexOptions.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions/vb/RegexOptions.vb#1)]

summary.span: Specifies that the regular expression is compiled to an assembly.

summary.span: This yields faster execution but increases startup time.

span.span: This yields faster execution but increases startup time.

summary.span: This value should not be assigned to the property when calling the method.

span.span: This value should not be assigned to the property when calling the method.

span.span: For more information, see the "Compiled Regular Expressions" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions ExplicitCapture = int32(4)
ExplicitCapture = 4

summary.span: Specifies that the only valid captures are explicitly named or numbered groups of the form (?<name>…).

span.span: Specifies that the only valid captures are explicitly named or numbered groups of the form (?<name>…).

summary.span: This allows unnamed parentheses to act as noncapturing groups without the syntactic clumsiness of the expression (?:…).

span.span: This allows unnamed parentheses to act as noncapturing groups without the syntactic clumsiness of the expression (?:…).

summary.span: For more information, see the "Explicit Captures Only" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

span.span: For more information, see the "Explicit Captures Only" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions IgnorePatternWhitespace = int32(32)
IgnorePatternWhitespace = 32

summary.span: Eliminates unescaped white space from the pattern and enables comments marked with #.

span.span: Eliminates unescaped white space from the pattern and enables comments marked with #.

summary.span: However, this value does not affect or eliminate white space in [character classes](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-classes-in-regular-expressions.md), numeric [quantifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/quantifiers-in-regular-expressions.md), or tokens that mark the beginning of individual [regular expression language elements](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-language-quick-reference.md).

span.span: However, this value does not affect or eliminate white space in [character classes](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-classes-in-regular-expressions.md), numeric [quantifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/quantifiers-in-regular-expressions.md), or tokens that mark the beginning of individual [regular expression language elements](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-language-quick-reference.md).

summary.span: For more information, see the "Ignore White Space" section of the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

span.span: For more information, see the "Ignore White Space" section of the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions Multiline = int32(2)
Multiline = 2

summary.span: Multiline mode.

span.span: Multiline mode.

summary.span: Changes the meaning of ^ and $ so they match at the beginning and end, respectively, of any line, and not just the beginning and end of the entire string.

span.span: Changes the meaning of ^ and $ so they match at the beginning and end, respectively, of any line, and not just the beginning and end of the entire string.

summary.span: For more information, see the "Multiline Mode" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

span.span: For more information, see the "Multiline Mode" section in the [Regular Expression Options](~/docs/standard/base-types/regular-expression-options.md) topic.

span.span: Specifies single-line mode.

summary.span: Changes the meaning of the dot (.) so it matches every character (instead of every character except \n).
